career.name: Hired Gun
career.description: When it comes to fighting, the Hired Gun is at the forefront. He's less of an independent operator than the Bounty Hunter, preferring to have a defined mission, an objective to achieve, and some credits to spend when the job is done. Hired Guns are the muscle and applied force, meant to defend or attack as the situation requires. They deal damage or protect others for credits, and this makes them simple and somteimes refreshingly direct.

specializations.name: Bodyguard
specializations.subtitle: Personal Defender
specializations.description: A Bodyguard will have a rather easy time finding work in the Outer Rim, especially if he doesn't mind looking after the backside of high-ranking criminal scum or corporate operators who are trying to do business without becoming victims. His facility with all kinds of weapons and vehicles make him useful to any number of quasi-legal or criminal operations.

specializations.subtitle: Up Close and Personal
specializations.description: Marauders don't necessarily mind shooting their opponents, but they would much rather get mixed up in a melee, weapons in hand, smashing and slashing their way through. Marauders are tough - probably the toughest combatants in any conflict. They tend to take a great deal of punishment while dealing out far more to any who dare go against them.

specializations.name: Demolitionist
specializations.subtitle: Force of Destruction
specializations.description: Demolitionists can be much more technically-minded than most Hired Guns. They are also suited to much more than straightforward combat. They can excel at setting traps, from improvised trip-wires tied to grenades to sophisticated proximity and timed explosives. Whereas another Hired Gun might go after an enemy in a straight-up fight, a Demolitionist may find a more inventive route, such as rigging a thermal detonator to explode when the target starts up his speeder. Some Demolitionists enjoy the thrill of combat as much as any other Hired Gun, however they favor flame projectors, grenade launchers, and missile tubes - anything that creates a large blast.

specializations.name: Heavy
specializations.subtitle: Overwhelming Firepower
specializations.description: Heavies do primarily one thing: wield large, dangerous weapons. From heavy blasters to missile tubes, Heavies favor big, loud, and devastating weaponry. Using such weapons is often punishing for the wielder, and characters must possess great fortitude in order to wield such weapons extensively. A high Resilience is often a side effect of the Heavy's actions, rather than the result of conscious training. Lugging around heavy weapons builds stamina, and simply dealing with the recoil provides a workout.
